    Pop-sci write-ups

    Opening New Vistas With Transversal Gates

    The Quantum Insider November 3, 2023

    An outlook on key features of neutral-atom quantum tech that allowed the advancing the age of error correction by several years.

    Feed-Forward Error Correction And Mid-Circuit Measurements

    The Quantum Insider August 18, 2023

    A brief analysis of features of neutral-atom quantum computers for scalable error-correction applications.

    Quantum Algorithms vs. Quantum-Inspired Algorithms

    The New Stack July 14, 2023

    This overview analyses whether the competition between modern classical and quantum computing paradigms is healthy for the industry.

    How we learned to program with atoms in 24 hours flat

    AWS Blog June 28, 2023

    Not fully written by me. I sponsored this AWS blog post for the winners of the 2023 issue of the MIT iQuHack quantum computing hackaton.

    Optimization with a Rydberg atom-based quantum processor

    AWS Blog November 10, 2022

    A detailed overview of early demonstrations of optimization problems of the Maximum Independent Set class using neutral-atom quantum computers.
